article_title: Paul Ryan Leading Republicans in House of Represenatives in Vote Tonight to End Obamacare
article_text:
Led by Speaker Paul Ryan (R-Wis.), the House is set to vote today at 7 P.M. to override President Obama's January 8 veto of legislation that would have ended the Affordable Care Act and effectively defunded Planned Parenthood. A memo released yesterday from Ryan's office indicates he believes they have the votes to override the veto without a Senate vote.

However, Ryan faces opposition from his own party, as hard-line Republicans are demanding concessions in other areas in exchange for their votes. Specifically, they want to step back from last year's budget deal with the Obama administration.

This will put the number of times Republicans have attempted to repeal Obamacare at well over 60, making the timing of the vote on Groundhog Day especially ironic. And, as in the movie, history is expected to repeat itself, with the challenge failing once again.

A memo released yesterday from Ryan's office indicates he believes they have the votes to override the veto without a Senate vote.
However, Ryan faces opposition from his own party, as hard-line Republicans are demanding concessions in other areas in exchange for their votes.
Led by Speaker Paul Ryan (R-Wis.), the House is set to vote today at 7 P.M. to override President Obama's January 8 veto of legislation that would have ended the Affordable Care Act and effectively defunded Planned Parenthood.
This will put the number of times Republicans have attempted to repeal Obamacare at well over 60, making the timing of the vote on Groundhog Day especially ironic.
And, as in the movie, history is expected to repeat itself, with the challenge failing once again.
